Html:
There is a large possibility that many people have transferred over programs and applications to Wabbitemu and they did not save. I am going to give a very simple solution for this problem.
  • Right click on the Wabbitemu
  • Go to File
  • Go to save...
  • Save it as a .sav (save state) and make sure it is in the folder for the Wabbitemu.
This should keep the programs and applications placed in Wabbitemu in the emulator. Thank you for reading my post and I hope it helps you. May the force be with you.

I get an error when I try to drag and drop apps to the wabbitemu. I choose second... Link... Recieve... 1:Recieve... and then drag and drop and get the error "a problem with wabbitemu prevented the file from getting sent". I've tried a few different apps with the same problem. Emu is set to run as TI-84+ Silver (non color) in Windows 8.1 64. The error prevents me from even getting to where I could "save" it.
